general_advisory: Need based irrigation is applied in field in case of no rainfall condition. Make provision for good drainage system in orchard and vegetable field. Prevailing weather condition is favourable for mealy bug attack in all types of crops so its regular monitoring should be advised. Farmers should avoid excess use of nitrogenous fertilizer at crop because it may extend the vegetative growth period and also attract various insect pests.

advisory: Farmers should maintain 5 cm water level in rice field for proper growth.

Disease Management: Bacterial leaf blight attack is observed in some fields, so spraying of Copper Oxychloride 50% WP @ 600g and Streptocycline @ 30g in 200 liters of water per acre should be advised under clear and calm weather.

Pest Management: Case worm attack is observed in some farmerâ€™s field and in severe cases farmers are advised to spray Fipronil 5% SC@ 400ml or Profenofos 50% EC @ 400ml per 200 liters of water per acre under clear weather. Previous weather condition was favourable for gall midge attack in rice field due to which an onion leaf or silver shoot like structure are formed so for its control farmers should spray thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 40g or Fipronil 5% SC @ 400 ml or Chloropyriphos 20 EC @ 500 ml in 200 liter water per acre in clear and calm weather condition.

To control the flower drop in cotton crop, application of Planofix @ 90 ml Gramin Krishi Mausam Sewa India Meteorological Department in 200 liters of water per acre after 60-65 days after sowing of seed.

To control sucking insect pest (Aphid, Thrips etc.) attack in cotton crop, application of Neem-based pesticide like Neem oil @ 600-800 ml + 200g detergent powder per acre by mixing with 200 liters of water should be advised at 30-45 days crop stage under clear weather. At the initial stage of flowering, farmers should avoid any chemical application in cotton crop.

To control Fruit and shoot borer in Brinjal, Tomato, Okra etc. spraying of Neem-based pesticide 1500 ppm @600ml per acre should be advised at initial stages. In severe cases, the alternate spray of Spinosad 45% SC @ 70ml and Emamectin benzoate @ 80g per acre at 15 days interval should be advised. If a sucking insect pest attack is noticed, then spraying of thiamethoxam @ 0.2 g or imidacloprid @ 0.33 ml per liter of water should be advised. For controlling some diseases like wilt, root rot, etc. farmers should use Carbendazim @ 2g or copper oxicloride @ 3ml per liter water under no rainfall condition.

Mastitis disease is also observed in some animals at present conditions due to which milk production and quality may hamper, so some preventive as well as control measures like pre and post dipping with antiseptic liquids, proper sanitation, preventing wet floor surface, feeding should be adjusted to avoid sitting of animals before the closure of teat sphincters after milking, lime application on the resting floor, etc. should be taken to control this disease. Freshwater availability should be ensured on the farm. In severe cases, consult the doctor from the nearby animal health center.
